td.p: This lecture revolves around the topic of algorithmic efficiency. It introduces the random access model (RAM) of computation and "big O notation" as a way to talk about order of growth. It concludes with binary search.

ul.li:
Optional Recitation: Algorithm Complexity and Class Review (00:42:12)
Flash and JavaScript are required for this feature.
Optional Recitation: Algorithm Complexity and Class Review
>Download from iTunes U (MP4)
>Download from Internet Archive (MP4)

div.p: Efficiency determines how long our programs take to run; when large sets of data are being handled, it can make a huge difference (on the order of years or even millennia) whether our program is efficient or not.

html.p: What notation do we use to state complexity?
